timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure about the placing the class under the logging package. As it informs about recovery processing it makes more sense to me to put it under recovery package. What was your reasoning about placing it here?
timeline.author: ochaloup

replies.bodyText: Since this class is only used by jtaLogger for now, therefore I thought of placing it under com.arjuna.ats.jta.logging package would be fine for now. Maybe later if any other package requires it, then we could move it under recovery package?
replies.author: mayankkunwar

replies.bodyText: I will move it to recovery package
replies.author: mayankkunwar

timeline.bodyText: What is your reasoning for naming the class as RecoveryRequired?
timeline.author: ochaloup

replies.bodyText: I thought it would add meaning to the action, that user has to take after he gets the result.
replies.author: mayankkunwar

timeline.bodyText: As this is a flag which is used to mark if a recovery problem occurs and this flag could be accessed from different threads and value could be set from the different threads then the code has to(!) consider that. The property should be of type atomic.
timeline.author: ochaloup

replies.bodyText: Sorry I missed this thought. Thanks for pointing this out. I will make it thread safe.
replies.author: mayankkunwar

timeline.bodyText: I think this is a good comment but I consider it should be put into the class jtaI18Logger as it's the place where new methods for logging are added (and where the methods are named). I think when it's here it's better chance to be missed.
timeline.author: ochaloup

replies.bodyText: Sure, I will move the comments to jtaI18Logger
replies.author: mayankkunwar
